response_parsed.title: Deploying Edge Runtimes Using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide explains how to deploy edge runtimes utilizing FastAPI, a modern web framework for building APIs with Python 3.12+. The process covers setting up the project, necessary dependencies, and deployment steps.
key_points: Install required packages like FastAPI, Uvicorn, and FastAPI-Microservices-Healthcheck
Create a main application file (e.g., `main.py`) with your API definitions
Set up Dockerfile for containerizing the application
Use Uvicorn to run the server locally
Test the API locally before deployment
Deploy the containerized FastAPI app to your preferred cloud platform or edge runtime service
Expose the API as a service for edge computing use cases

code_examples.code:
FROM python:3.12
WORKDIR /app
COPY requirements.txt .
RUN pip install -r requirements.txt
COPY main.py .
CMD ["uvicorn", "main:app", "--host", "0.0.0.0", "--port", "80"]

version_notes: This guide is based on FastAPI version 0.74.0 and Python 3.12
Update the versions of packages as needed when new versions are released
caveats: Ensure your edge runtime supports Python 3.12 for seamless integration with FastAPI
Configure the deployment settings and environment variables according to your specific edge runtime service provider
